product_name: Kiehl's Since 1851Creamy Eye Treatment with Avocado
summary: SummaryHighlightsClean IngredientsVeganSustainable PackagingGive BackThe Kiehl's Since 1851 Creamy Eye Treatment with Avocado is a hydrating, fragrance-free eye cream that de-puffs and brightens under eyes.
details: DetailsBenefitsKiehl's #1 hydrating eye cream delivers a pop of energy for tired, fatigued eyesProvides all day hydration, which may help prevent early signs of agingImmediately improves under eye textureUnique water-in-oil formula that provides instant and long-term hydrationUniquely concentrated formula does not migrate into eyesOphthalmologist- and dermatologist-tested for safetyFor all skin types, including sensitive skinMade with recyclable packagingKey IngredientsAvocado Oil: visibly de-puffs & nourishes the eye area with moistureBeta-Carotene: brightens the eye area & defends against tired-looking eyesSodium & Copper PCA: fortifies & helps skin retain moisture for a visibly smoother eye areaResearch ResultsReduces puffiness by 32%*Improves smoothness by 25%**Improves brightness by 11%***BEFORE & AFTER 94% Agree Eye Area Looks Less Puffy* 90% Agree Eye Area Looks Smoother** 90% Agree Under-Eye Area Looks Brighter****Results based upon expert grading evaluated with product in a 4-week clinical test.**Results based on a 4-week consumer perception study on 50 subjects.***Results based on expert grading in a 4-week clinical study using average results for puffiness and brightness.Item 2536674How To UseKiehl's brightening eye cream transforms into a burst of fresh hydration while leaving a protective layer that seals in all day moisture.Step 1: Scoop a rice grain-size amount onto your ring finger.Step 2: Rub it between your fingers to break up the formula.Step 3: Gently tap the hydrating eye cream around your eye area until it's completely absorbed.Tip: Use morning and night, after cleansing and toning to brighten & hydrate the under-eye area.IngredientsAqua/Water, Butyrospermum Parkii Butter / Shea Butter, Butylene Glycol, Tridecyl Stearate, Peg-30 Dipolyhydroxystearate, Isodecyl Salicylate, Tridecyl Trimellitate, Persea Gratissima Oil / Avocado Oil, Isocetyl Stearoyl Stearate, Propylene Glycol, Dipentaerythrityl Hexacaprylate/Hexacaprate, Sorbitan Sesquioleate, Magnesium Sulfate, Hydrogenated Castor Oil, Sodium Pca, Phenoxyethanol, Chlorphenesin, Hydrogenated Jojoba Oil, P-Anisic Acid, Tocopheryl Acetate, Isopropyl Palmitate, Disodium Edta, Copper Pca, Helianthus Annuus Seed Oil / Sunflower Seed Oil, CI 40800/Beta-Carotene, Citric Acid.Shipping & Coupon RestrictionsThis brand is excluded from most Ulta Beauty coupons.See brand eligibility details
how_to_use: Kiehl's brightening eye cream transforms into a burst of fresh hydration while leaving a protective layer that seals in all day moisture.Step 1: Scoop a rice grain-size amount onto your ring finger.Step 2: Rub it between your fingers to break up the formula.Step 3: Gently tap the hydrating eye cream around your eye area until it's completely absorbed.Tip: Use morning and night, after cleansing and toning to brighten & hydrate the under-eye area.
ingredients: Helianthus Annuus Seed Oil / Sunflower Seed Oil

reviews.headline: Creamy avocado eye treatment
reviews.comments: I have been using this cream for years now.. It has creamy dense texture yet still light.Works great for me.

reviews.headline: Favorite eye cream
reviews.comments: Used Clinique Rich eye cream for years. This is so much better. My concealer goes on better, it hydrates better without being too greasy and definitely purely has helped with brightening.

reviews.headline: Excellent product!
reviews.comments: Softened and pumped crows feet and wrinkled areas below my cheekbones. Rated 93/100 Excellent for pure non-toxic ingredients by Yuka (phone app). I am 80, a melanoma survivor, and have many allergies/sensitivities. Love this safe, clean product!

reviews.headline: Seperates
reviews.comments: Would use for years. Started noticing it separates some time ago. Will never buy again. Quality is garbage now

reviews.headline: YASSSSSSS!
reviews.comments: I was having major dryness/crepiness under my 47 yr old eyes. Tried this *hoping* it would provide some relief. Boy did it ever! I use it at night, dont rub it in- just leave a light layer on- and it has changed my undereye texture for the better. Maybe even has helped w brightening? Maybe. Either way- next time I'll get the large one.

reviews.headline: Stays put and doesn't make my eyes water!
reviews.comments:
Only eye cream I've used that stays where I put it and doesn't make me cry avocado tears everywhere. Super thick and hydrating as well. Great basic eye cream.
Note - a little goes a long way. Idk how ANYONE would use the full size before it expired

reviews.headline: New favorite
reviews.comments: I used it for the first time and i swear it instantly brightened my eyes! The texture is sticky but super hydrating all the other creams I've used dry up so quick

reviews.headline: Excellent
reviews.comments: It works great as a makeup primer and moisturizes dark circles.

reviews.headline: Hydrate
reviews.comments:
This is very very hydrating and is also good for sensitive skin. I've used this in the past.
I personally didn't see any other benefits like having puffiness or fine lines addressed. I now have to use something that addresses puffiness too but this is great if you're looking for a boost of hydration

reviews.headline: Super hydrating!!
reviews.comments: I'm obsessed with this eye cream! My eye area is super dry and sensitive and this formula hydrates it so well without any irritation.

reviews.headline: This product never runs out, and that's a good thing
reviews.comments: The Christmas of 2023 i bought the MINI of this product and i still have it granted i don't use it everyday just because i forget but it still means that you don't need lots and it LASTS. I love this product soo much and am looking forward to repurchasing when it is empty. The only reason that i put 4 stars which i wish i could add like 3/4s a star is because sometimes it separates a little and if you leave it on its side because of the container it can spill but that was my bad

reviews.headline: My favorite
reviews.comments: I could never find an eye cream I liked until trying this one. None seem to adequately moisturize my dry under eyes… till now. It's moisturizing AND wears well under concealer.

reviews.headline: $ wasted
reviews.comments: I fell in love with the face cream and clay so I went into to get this little gem and it was a lemon for me. It did provide moisture but I didnt see any benefit to my under eye hue. Is totally overpriced in my opinion for simply lubricating such a small portion of my face.

reviews.headline: insane dryness and allergic reaction
reviews.comments: let me preface this by saying my skin is not sensitive— i worled at ulta and tried virtually every product. this is the only one that caused a reaction. dry scaly bumps all under my eyes, red and gross looking UGH

reviews.headline: insane dryness and allergic reaction
reviews.comments: let me preface this by saying my skin is not sensitive— i worled at ulta and tried virtually every product. this is the only one that caused a reaction. dry scaly bumps all under my eyes, red and gross looking UGH

reviews.headline: Excellent eye cream!
reviews.comments: Perfect for anyone with normal to dry skin. Not for oily skin types IMO. I LOVE this eye cream both personally and professionally (MUA). It is unique in that it STAYS exactly where you put it on the skin and doesn't slide around. It also is super hydrating and the green tint helps with undereye discoloration; you still need concealer obviously, but it does a little bit to neutralize redness. Best eye cream I've found and no added fragrance!!

reviews.headline: Excellent eye cream
reviews.comments:
I love this product. It is feeding and Rich and for my mature skin. I do find it extremely helpful 
I am sorry it is not stocked in, however, happy that I can order it online with you

reviews.headline: First time buy and I'm obsessed!
reviews.comments: I absolutely love the way this eye treament applies. It literally leaves around my eyes so hydradeted and smooth throughout the day. A littlr goes a long way so the jar will last ypu a fee months. Smells great and applies well. Love it!

reviews.headline: First time buy and I'm obsessed!
reviews.comments: I absolutely love the way this eye treament applies. It literally leaves around my eyes so hydradeted and smooth throughout the day. A littlr goes a long way so the jar will last ypu a fee months. Smells great and applies well. Love it!

faceoff_positive.comments: I've been searching for a good eye cream and sometimes it seems endless. I am 57 and have puffiness, dryness, and what seem like more-than-fine lines and wrinkles sometimes. Oh, and, of course, dark circles. I purchased the Kiehl's Creamy Eye Treatment with Avocado during Ulta's 21 Days of Beauty Sale at 50% off to see what it was like. A lot of the reviews said that it was too thick or sticky. Well, I LOVE this fact. I barely have to touch my finger into the cream and enough sticks to it that I can dab it onto one eye along the orbital bone (read: my dark circles) and then I go back and do the same for the other eye. So little is used that I feel like one jar will last a long time! It IS very thick and it IS sticky, but I just dab my ring finger over the dots that I made and it starts to melt into my under eye area. I have been using the Eye Treatment for about a month and I have noticed such a difference in the appearance of my eyes! First of all, my fine lines and wrinkles have all but disappeared! I had some pretty bad ones because I had really bad allergies this summer and had been rubbing my eyes (I know, not a smart thing to do!), which made my wrinkles so much worse. The puffiness under my eyes has decreased a lot, as well. Hopefully the longer I use the cream, the better it will get. The other great thing about the Eye Treatment is that the bright green color really helps with my dark circles. Finally, I put primer on over it all and then concealer and it stays on all day, no problem. All in all, I would recommend this eye cream to anyone that's trying to find a good one! I will definitely be buying this one again, and at full price, it's still worth it to me!!
faceoff_positive.headline: This was a definite YES for me!

faceoff_negative.comments: One of the 'heaviest' eye creams I've used to date. Yes I was pretty much expecting it to be on the richer side when I discovered that 'Shea Butter' is the second ingredient in here, but even though I warm this up between my fingers before dabbing on, as per the instructions, it still does not absorb properly and leaves an oily film on my skin that never quite sinks in. On a night this isn't really an issue, but during the day there's no way I could use this and then apply eye make up or concealer. I used up the sample sachet I was given, which lasted me just over 2 weeks using it on and off, but this isn't a product I could get away with using constantly as it would almost definitely cause Milia - which has always been the case for me when using similarly heavy eye creams in the past. That and the fact that it contains not one but FOUR different types of parabens makes it a definite 'No' when it comes to the question of actually purchasing the full size product. I don't strictly avoid parabens in cosmetics or skincare, but when there's that many of them, and in something which is applied that close to the eyes, I'd just prefer giving it a miss, especially when there are so many paraben-free alternatives out there for me to choose from. -> My 'Ulta Beauty Top 7 must-have list' (thought it might be useful to share my 7 favorite beauty products of all time, focusing mainly on my purchases at Ulta) < - < 1. Hair Loss Treatment: Divine Herbal Hair Oil < 2. Eye Cream: Clinique All about eyes < 3. Lip Gloss: Clarins Lip Comfort Oil < 4. Makeup Remover: Lancome Bi Facil < 5. Pigmentation + Anti-Aging Serum: Divine Herbal Facial Treatment Serum < 6. Eyeliner: Ulta Beauty Gel Eyeliner Pencil < 7. Moisturizer: 'Lush' – Enzymion
faceoff_negative.headline: Too rich for me...
